trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Rochester
There were no other sightings in Rochester on or around March 21st 2009
divs: sighting detailsaround 8pm, i was outside chatting with a friend in my driveway. i observed a bright object moving low across the sky. it was a reddish-white colored light and at one point became extremely bright (mostly white) while continuing along its trajectory. there was no indication of any strobes or beacons as i normally would associate with aircraft. it was moving away from us in a nw direction. no sound whatsoever could be heard and the brightness i observed could only be compared to a very close plane approaching us with its landing lights on. this object however was traveling away from us and away from any nearby airports. i estimate initial brightness at 5x the brightest star or planet in the sky and peak brightness at about 10x. the object disappeared from view beyond the horizon\tree line heading in a nw direction. it was moving rapidly enough to cover a large swath of sky in less than a minute. impossible to estimate the exact distance from our vantage point, but i would figure 5 miles north of us, give or take. i felt as though i had just watched an event in progress that was difficult to explain or compare to any other aircraft i had seen up to this point. i scanned the sky and noticed a plane that was heading south to north in same general direction as where we lost sight of the object. the plane's altitude was 2-3 times higher in the sky, it was only noticeable by the tell-tale strobe-beacon light and seemed to be traveling no more than 1\4 of the speed of the first object we had observed.
Summary: Star-like, color-changing, low-flying object, moving quickly across the horizon.
